makers.displaydate: 1864–1901; born Albi, France; died Château de Malromé, Saint-André-du-Bois, France
makers.displaymaker: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, 1864–1901; born Albi, France; died Château de Malromé, Saint-André-du-Bois, France
Published by Édouard Kleinmann, French, active late 19th century
Printed by Chaix, French, active late 19th century

texts.textentryhtml: Color lithographic posters proliferated in Paris during the 1890s due to technical advances in the printing trades and the relaxation of laws restricting the placement and distribution of advertisements. Toulouse-Lautrec enthusiastically embraced this commercial art form, creating sensational large-scale advertisements for a wide range of stylish publications, theatrical entertainments, and musical reviews in belle epoque Paris. Immortalized by Toulouse-Lautrec in numerous paintings and posters, the dancer Jane Avril is perhaps best remembered as the star of the can-can reviews at the famed Montmartre cabaret Moulin Rouge.
texts.remarks: K4-6 Rotation August 2015, K 4-6 Gallery Rotation May 2012
